sentence.Network_en: He had no great hopes for the success of his undertaking.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对自己事业的成功不抱太大希望。

sentence.Network_en: His first essay in running a company was a notoriously tough undertaking.
sentence.Network_cn: 众所周知，他第一次尝试经营公司时十分艰难。

sentence.Network_en: This mammoth undertaking was completed in 18 months.
sentence.Network_cn: 这项艰巨的任务在18个月内完成了。

entry.def: An undertaking is a task or job, especially a large or difficult one.

example.ex: Organizing the show has been a massive undertaking.
example.tran: 组织那场演出是一项浩大的工程。

entry.def: If you give an undertaking to do something, you formally promise to do it.

example.ex: The MOD gave an undertaking to Saville that it had provided him with all relevant material.
example.tran: 国防部向萨维尔保证已向他提供了所有相关的资料。

means.word_mean: 1. any piece of work that is undertaken or attempted;
2. the trade of a funeral director

Sentence.sentence: Why is Google undertaking such a venture?
It is basically a social undertaking.

means.word_mean: （重大或艰巨的）任务，项目，事业；企业

sentences.en: He associated himself with his friend in a business undertaking.
He is too timid to venture upon an undertaking.
sentences.cn: 他太胆小,不敢从事任何事业。

sentences.en: He has sunk half his fortune into a new business undertaking.
sentences.cn: 他已把一半财产投资于一个新企业。

sentences.en: give an undertaking not to take sides
